h1.span: Want to help KGBSD feed kids in Ketchikan during the COVID-19 school facility closures?

div.strong: Complete the Free and Reduced Price Meal Application online TODAY!
Why would this help? The meals are already free?

span.div: KGBSD receives reimbursements for meals provided to students who qualify and helps us make meals free to everyone during the school closure. If more households qualified, it would help us keep the program going for as long as possible. Plus, we know many families have experienced a loss of hours or income. Applying now could qualify your household for free or reduced-price meals even after school starts back up. Help us offer meals to more of Ketchikan's kids, including your own!

div.strong: But I already completed an application earlier this year and was denied. Should I really apply again?

div.div: If you were denied earlier this year, apply again! You can apply as many times during the year as you need and can use your past month's, current month's, or next month's income. Reduced hours or a change of income as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic could mean you now qualify for free and reduced meals for the rest of the year.
Apply anyway! Especially if you have had a change in your household size and are caring for more individuals.

strong.span: Complete the application online today: https://www.kgbsd.org/Page/421

div.div: Don't have online access? Request a Free and Reduced Price Meals Application from any of the school lunch sites during meal pick-up, or request one for delivery!
Need assistance? Call Dawna Hull at 907-228-8803 or email dawna.hull@k21schools.org.
THIS INSTITUTION IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

a.title: Go to comments for Free Reduced Lunch Application

img.strong: To Read More About the KGBSD COVID-19 updates visit https://www.kgbsd.org/coronavirus

p.span: KGBSD Food Service Plan during School Closure

span.p: Beginning March 23rd and lasting for the extent of the school closure, KGBSD will be offering food service for children 18 years of age or younger at the following locations:
“Grab-n-go” meals will be provided at each facility Monday-Friday in drive-through style pick up at each location during the following times:

Owing to the need to social distance and keep KGBSD facilities clean and secure, meals will be offered in a drive-through fashion, meaning parents, guardians, or caregivers can pull up to the curb at a designated entrance at each of the locations, and staff will come out to greet you at your vehicle, take names and meal orders, and deliver meals directly to your vehicle. Look for signs or staff at each of the locations for pick up spots!
These meals will be provided under the model of the Summer Food Service Program, with the following requirements:

ul.li: All children ages 0-18 will be served at any location listed above. (Schoenbar will be the main hub for food distribution.)
Children must be present in order to pick up a meal, in accordance with federal requirements.
Meals will be provided based on the current March Lunch Menu, posted on the district’s website.
Children and their parents will be allowed to pick up both meals (breakfast & lunch or lunch & snack) at each of the open pick up times, 2 meals per student/child per day.
Students and children receiving meals must provide names upon pick up.

If students and children with food allergies or meal modifications plan to receive a meal, their parent and/or guardian/caregiver will need to RSVP to Food Service Manager no later than the morning of meal service to be prepared by the lunchtime distribution period: Call 907-228-7215 or email brock@k21schools.org

Parents of students who are homebound, medically fragile, or who cannot otherwise access transportation to one of the approved locations should contact Katie Parrott, Business Manager at 907-247-2116 or email parrott@k21schools.org to discuss options

span.p: Any questions or concerns? Contact Katie Parrott (907) 247-2116 katie.parrott@k21schools.org
This institution is an equal opportunity provider.
We know that this is an uncertain and difficult time for students, parents, and families. KGBSD is committed to supporting our community in tangible ways as much as we can during this time.

a.title: Go to comments for PSA Food Service Program

div.span: Ketchikan Gateway Borough School District uses the SchoolMessenger notification system to provide timely communication to parents and staff members on matters such as attendance, lunch balances, transportation, school activities, and emergencies. This system is designed to send phone calls, emails, and text messages; allowing you to select how you prefer to be contacted.

div.div: The district will only use the service to provide information that is timely and relevant.
To participate in the text messaging service, you must indicate your willingness to receive text messages to your phone. The process is simple and only takes a few seconds to complete.

div.strong: Simply text any one of the following words to the number 68453: subscribe, option, yes

div.div: You’ll know you were successful if you receive the following reply message: You are registered 4 SchoolMessenger notifications. Reply STOP to quit, HELP for help.

In addition to performing the opt-in process above, you’ll want to ensure that the district has your current wireless number(s) in our student information database. If you haven’t already provided that information to your school, do so.

a.title: Go to comments for Sign up for Schoolmessenger

img.alt: 2019-2020 School Lunch Program Income Eligibility Guidelines & Application

a.span: 2019-2020 School Lunch Program Income Eligibility Guidelines & Application

div.p: The Ketchikan Gateway Borough School District is pleased to announce our participation in the National School Lunch Program. Meals will be available to all children at our following schools: Houghtaling, Fawn Mountain, Point Higgins, Ketchikan Charter School, Tongass School, Schoenbar, Revilla, and Kayhi. Meals meet nutritional standards set by the U.S. Department of Agriculture.

a.title: Go to comments for 2019-2020 School Lunch Program Income Eligibility Guidelines & Application

div.p: Available as a service to Alaskan students in grades K-12. Offered Seven Days a week from noon to 2am Alaska Time.

p.span: Welcome to the Ketchikan Gateway Borough School District.

span.style: box-sizing: border-box; font-style: italic; color: #333333; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; font-size: medium;

p.span: Enrolling your child in school is easy with our online registration portal. To get started with enrolling your student(s) into school click on the New Student Registration icon below and choose "Create Account".

span.style: box-sizing: border-box; font-style: italic; color: #333333; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; font-size: medium;

p.span: 1. Know what your school of choice is. Visit our School Choice page for more information.

span.style: box-sizing: border-box; font-style: italic; color: #333333; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; font-size: medium;

box-sizing: border-box; font-style: italic; color: #333333; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue'; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; font-size: medium;

p.span: -Required Documents (Birth Certificate and Proof of Immunization) these can be uploaded or brought to your school.

p.span: We have exciting news. Beginning on April 1, you have a new wellness platform we think you are going to love. This new portal brings many new features and capabilities, such as an all new health assessment, online university courses, quicker data uploads, a mobile app, texting capabilities and hundreds of new challenges. We can’t wait to have you experience this!
To get started, simply create an account at
. Enter your information as it is appears on your medical ID Card.

img.title: Click Here Icon
img.a: To learn more visit our district Employee Health Resouces Page.

img.title: Teladoc

h2.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: bold; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: 15px; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; color: #333333; letter-spacing: normal; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; text-align: center;

span.style: color: #333333; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: large; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: normal; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px; display: inline ! important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff;
span.a: Speak to a Doctor Anytime with Teladoc

a.title: Alternative Formats

span.style: color: #333333; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal; line-height: normal; orphans: auto; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 1; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; display: inline !important; float: none; background-color: #ffffff;

p.span: Teladoc is a national network of U.S. board-certified physicians and pediatricians that lets you resolve your routine medical issues, on-demand 24/7, via phone or online video consultations from wherever you happen to be. This is a FREE service for those with insurance through KGBSD.

a.title: Go to comments for Teledoc 24/7 Access to a Doctor

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: BridgeHealth

h3.span: Your KGBSD insurance includes the BridgeHealth Surgery Benefit

span.strong: The BridgeHealth Surgery Benefit, gives you access to:

li.h2: Centers of Excellence for major planned surgeries and procedures.
Coverage for travel costs for you and a companion.
Provisions to eliminate your out-of-pocket costs.
A dedicated Care Coordinator who provides service and support.

h3.span: Having surgery? How can you take advantage of BridgeHealth?

span.h3: Simply call 1-800-680-1366 to speak with a Care Coordinator and explore what this benefit can do for you.
To view BridgeHealth flyer, click here.

a.title: Go to comments for BridgeHealth
